skills.name: Rotate an object or point 90° clockwise or anticlockwise about a point, where the point lies on the edge or outside of the object
Describe a 90° or 270° rotation giving the angle and direction of rotation, and the coordinates of the centre of rotation, where the centre of rotation lies on the edge or outside of the object

explanations.A: I think you have chosen the point that is halfway between the point. If you rotated the red shape around A it would be too high.
explanations.B: Almost, just remember we write coordinates (x,y)
explanations.C: Using tracing paper, if you trace the outline of the red shape and the y-axis, then try a 'best guess' at a point of rotation, using your pencil to fix that point and turning clockwise until the y-axis you traced becomes a horizontal line. Only by choosing the point (1,0) will the traced shape fit over the blue shape, making this the centre of rotation.
explanations.D: Perhaps you've only come across rotation questions where the origin is the centre of rotation. It's possible that any point can be a centre of rotation. Try using tracing paper to help you

explanations.A: Start by tracing shape A and the x axis. Rotate the shape 270 degrees anticlockwise using each of the possible answers A to D. You'll find that (1, 3) works! Alternatively, drawing a line from one point on shape A to the point (1, 3), then back to its corresponding point on shape B gives a right angle and lines of equal length. This is not the case with the other coordinates.
